image.altText: A centrlink sign through a bush.

props.synopsis: The unemployment rate remained at 3.9 per cent in December, but ABS figures reveal more than 65,000 jobs were lost during the month, the biggest fall since 1993 outside of COVID lockdown periods.

title.children: Shock loss of 65,000 jobs before Christmas the biggest outside of COVID since 1993

image.altText: An older man holds up a photo of a bushfire. He and his wife look sombre.

props.synopsis: It has been 10 years since the Bangor bushfire raged through the southern Flinders Ranges, but those who witnessed it remember it like it was yesterday.

title.children: Victims of one of SA's worst bushfires look back on loss and recovery

image.altText: A screenshot of grainy CCTV vision showing dozens of people standing insight a tight space

props.synopsis: Confronting CCTV has captured a prison guard assaulting a handcuffed, 16-year-old inside a notorious youth jail in Perth.

title.children: 'You know there's a camera up there?': CCTV assault on handcuffed teen reveals youth justice problems

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf  smiling

props.synopsis: Antoinette Lattouf claims she was unlawfully dismissed by the public broadcaster over an Instagram post when she was terminated three days into a five-day contract to present on ABC Radio Sydney.

title.children: Former ABC presenter Antoinette Lattouf vows to fight unlawful termination case 'as long as it takes'

image.altText: Travis Head holds up his bat and kisses his helmet

props.synopsis: Australia has overhauled the West Indies' first innings total and taken a decent first-innings lead on day two of the first Test at Adelaide Oval. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Australia bowled out with a lead of 95 after Head's ton thwarts West Indies

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia all out for 283, lead by 95

image.altText: A man holds up a tennis ball and a racquet.

props.synopsis: Max Purcell fails to get the better of world number 11 Casper Ruud in a five-set thriller to bow out of the Australian Open. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie Max Purcell out of Australian Open after five-set battle, as Świątek clinches win to advance to third round

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ruud gets the better of Purcell, wins the second round match
We're not done yet, Ruud and Purcell to battle it out in final tiebreak
Świątek fights back to defeat Collins

image.altText: Novak Djokovic looks ahead during his second-round match at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: It may seem odd to some, but for 15 years Novak Djokovic has been a regular visitor to the Botanic Gardens for a particular reason, as he looks to cope with the pressure of playing in the Australian Open.

title.children: 'A special relationship': The 'old friend' Djokovic visits each year in Melbourne's Royal Botanic Gardens

image.altText: A weather map shows a cyclone crossing the Queensland coast

props.synopsis: A tropical low in the Coral Sea is expected to develop into a cyclone by Monday, with a "significant risk" the system may impact the Queensland coast from Tuesday onwards.

title.children: Latest predicted tropical cyclone could hit anywhere from Mt Isa to New Caledonia — but it will be intense, BOM says

image.altText: Heather Mack

props.synopsis: A US woman who pleaded guilty to helping kill her mother and stuffing the body in a suitcase during a luxury vacation in Bali 10 years ago has been sentenced to 26 years in prison.

title.children: Daughter jailed for helping kill mother and stuffing body in suitcase on Bali holiday

image.altText: A male, caucasian politican speakking at a press conference, infron of blank curtains and flags

props.synopsis: Workplace Relations Minister Tony Burke has accused port operator DP World of acting in bad faith in its pay dispute with the Maritime Union.

title.children: Tony Burke accuses DP World of acting in bad faith over port dispute

image.altText: Premier Chirs Minns looks to his left.

props.synopsis: The NSW Premier says the government will not meet the housing target set out by the Commonwealth but plans are in place to boost supply in the future.

title.children: The NSW government has made a frank admission on housing. Industry insiders aren't surprised by it

image.altText: Aerial vision of an algae bloom at a Perth beach

props.synopsis: An algal bloom has shut a popular Perth beach, with locals concerned the outbreak is linked with treated wastewater pouring into the ocean.

title.children: Sewage contamination concerns raised as algal bloom shuts popular Perth beach

image.altText: A man robs a store wearing a clown mask

props.synopsis: An armed man has robbed a store in Holland Park in Brisbane's south wearing a clown mask and brandishing what appears to be a gun before fleeing with a sum of cash.

title.children: Video shows armed man in clown mask robbing Brisbane business, fleeing with cash

image.altText: a young african man sitting behind weights at a gym

props.synopsis: NT Police have upgraded charges against two of the people charged over the death of 19-year-old Yiel Gatluak, as fresh claims are heard in court about an alleged attack against him

title.children: Three people now charged with murder of teenager in Alice Springs, after police upgrade charges

image.altText: A line of trucks at a stop

props.synopsis: Truck drivers are warning caravanners not to park in their rest stops because of the potentially devastating consequences of missing a fatigue break.

title.children: Truck drivers plead with caravanners to stay away from truck rest stops

image.altText: Dr Ash Gordon wears a white collared shirt and blue blazer and smiles in front of a cream brick wall.

props.synopsis: Two 16-year-old boys have been arrested and charged with aggravated burglary and the alleged murder of Box Hill doctor Ash Gordon.

title.children: Sneakers, headphones stolen from home of Melbourne doctor before alleged murder, court hears

image.altText: Broken Hill court on a clear sunny day.

props.synopsis: Corrective Services NSW have launched a full investigation into how the 24-year-old was able to escape the local courthouse.

title.children: Police arrest Broken Hill inmate almost three days after escape

image.altText: Ayo Edebiri and Jeremy Allen White hold their Emmy awards

props.synopsis: Not only has Ayo Edebiri cleaned up with trophies this awards season — she's also (and this is more important) stolen the internet's heart. Join us as we unpack why.

title.children: She's cleaned up awards season and Ireland adores her. Who is Ayo Edebiri and why is she stealing hearts?

image.altText: Some people in a car

props.synopsis: Keen Queensland beachgoer Brian Devitt was unable to swim due to his age, but his children and a group of lifesavers have helped him relive his youth.

title.children: Surf lifesavers give 'incredible' gift to grandfather who thought he'd never swim at the beach again

image.altText: Princess of wales

props.synopsis: As King Charles seeks treatment for an enlarged prostate, his daughter-in-law faces up to two weeks in hospital after undergoing abdominal surgery.

title.children: King Charles to undergo treatment for enlarged prostate, as Kate Middleton recovers in hospital after surgery

image.altText: A woman stands on the side of a road holding a tax the rich sign.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of billionaires and multimillionaires have penned a letter calling on global leaders to fairly tax the super-rich, stating they'd "be proud to pay more".

title.children: Billionaires call on global leaders to tax them more

image.altText: Australian basketballer Josh Giddey looks down the court during an NBA game as he holds the ball in his left hand.

props.synopsis: California police have dropped their investigation into NBA star Josh Giddey's alleged relationship with a minor.

title.children: Australian basketball star Josh Giddey will not face charges over alleged relationship with minor

image.altText: composite image of Ross Knight of Cosmic Psychos, Debbie Harry of Blondie, and Brian Molko of Placebo

props.synopsis: The massive line-up features some of the most influential artists of all time.

title.children: Blondie, Placebo, Deep Purple lead enormous Pandemonium Festival line-up for this April

image.altText: People attend a beach on a sunny day

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting warmer-than-average temperatures for much of the country in February, with wetter-than-normal conditions currently underway in central and eastern Australia expected to continue for the rest of January.

title.children: What's in store for Australia's weather for the rest of summer?

image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Economists say Australia's unemployment rate remaining steady at 3.9 per cent in December will be "good news" for the RBA, while the ASX is lower after investors pared back their global rate cut expectations. Follow live.

title.children: Unemployment rate and part-time work shift 'good news' for the RBA ahead of February meeting, ASX falls

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pre-Christmas jobs plunge to keep interest rates on hold: Refinitiv
Why didn't the unemployment rate fall in December if we lost 65,000 jobs?
Move over Samsung, Apple's iPhone is now the world's best-selling smartphone

image.altText: Richard Roxburgh stands in front of scaffolding and a lit-up neon U Star logo of a U and a star shape in a circle.

props.synopsis: New Australian drama series Prosper stars Richard Roxburgh and Rebecca Gibney as the Quinns: the powerful family behind a fictional megachurch.

title.children: Richard Roxburgh and Rebecca Gibney are a megachurch power-couple in Prosper

image.altText: Kyrgios

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios offers to "climb into the crowd" to sort out a heckler, as Novak Djokovic bemoans a difficult atmosphere at the Australian Open.

title.children: 'There's an absence of courage': Djokovic hits out at Aus Open crowd as Kyrgios offers to 'sort out' heckler

image.altText: A police car with its lights on.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne police officer has been charged with sexual assault following a string of alleged incidents while he was on duty.

title.children: Melbourne police officer facing three sexual assault charges

image.altText: A computer generated image of the SLIM spacecraft separating from a rocket

props.synopsis: Japan is planning to land a car-sized spacecraft on the Moon this week. If SLIM succeeds, it will make history and pave the way for building landers that can explore the Solar System's  planets and moons.

title.children: Japan's SLIM spacecraft set to attempt historic '20 minutes of terror' Moon landing this week
